qas.question: What type of church do Protestants believe in?

answers.text: all who profess faith in Jesus Christ

qas.question: What is the name of the main principles of Protestantism?
What other entities are also considered to be Protestant?
What Catholic doctrine do Protestants not believe in?

answers.text: it is the one true church

context: Protestants reject the Roman Catholic Church's doctrine that <a4_0>it is the one true church<a4_0/>, believing in <a0_0>the invisible church<a0_0/>, which consists of <a1_0>all who profess faith in Jesus Christ<a1_0/>. Some Protestant denominations are less accepting of other denominations, and the basic orthodoxy of some is questioned by most of the others. Individual denominations also have formed over very subtle theological differences. Other denominations are simply regional or ethnic expressions of the same beliefs. Because <a2_0>the five solas<a2_0/> are the main tenets of the Protestant faith, <a3_0>non-denominational groups and organizations<a3_0/> are also considered Protestant.
